articles.title: Scientists rewired Down syndrome brain circuits by restoring a missing molecule
articles.description: A missing brain molecule may be disrupting neural wiring in Down syndrome, according to new research. Replacing it in adult mice rewired brain circuits and improved brain flexibility, challenging the idea that treatment must happen before birth.

articles.title: A flesh-eating fly once eradicated is moving back toward the U.S.
articles.description: California researchers are preparing for the possible return of the New World screwworm, a parasitic fly that feeds on living flesh and once devastated U.S. livestock. By monitoring traps and educating veterinarians and farmers, they hope to stop the pest before it gains a foothold.

articles.title: Pulitzer Prize-winning correspondent Peter Arnett, who reported from Vietnam and Gulf War, has died
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Peter Arnett, the Pulitzer Prize-winning reporter who spent decades dodging bullets and bombs to bring the world eyewitness accounts of war from the rice paddies of Vietnam to the deserts of Iraq, has died at 91. Arnett, who won the 1966 Pulitzer Prize for international reporting
